ygData.subject: Re: ct2ctml error

Dr. Goodwin:

I am still not able to successfully execute a Cantera demo because of
the same error:
	Procedure: ct2ctml
	Error:   could not convert input file to CTML

I am using WinXP Pro SP2.  Today I also installed Cantera and Python
on my old computer running Win 2000.  Running the demos on this
machine also failed and indicated the same error.
  
Also, I did copy the ctml_writer module to the 'site_pakages\Cantera'
folder and I can now run the 'check' script from Python IDLE.  It
appeared to execute successfully.  I am also able to run the 'cttmp'
file from IDLE to generate a 'gri30.xml' file.

Incidentally, Josh Freeh on Mac Os X denotes a similar error. 
However, unlike Josh, the error is not resolved when Python is
executed from DOS command prompt.

Thank you for your help,
-Tom 


--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, David Goodwin <dgoodwin@c...> wrote:
> Tom -
> 
> The 'check' script is run whenever the 'cttmp' script fails, to see
if 
> the problem is with the Cantera installation.  Unfortunately the 
> single-line 'check' script will always fail, since it tries to
import 
> module 'ctml_writer' from the Cantera package  (where it used to
be), 
> instead of importing it directly.  The workaround is to copy file 
> 'ctml_writer.py' from the 'site_packages' folder in the Python
Library 
> folder to the 'Cantera' folder within 'site_packages'.   it seems
to me 
> now that running the 'check' script is more trouble than it is
worth, 
> and I am removing this step from the procedure followed to
translate 
> input files.
> 
> But this does not answer why the cttmp script fails, since it works 
> when you run it from the command line.  I'm not sure why that is 
> happening, but it must be some sort of path problem.  Perhaps try
the 
> above fix and try again and see what happens...
> 
> By the way - I assume you are using WinXP or Win2000.  Cantera will 
> encounter problems under Win98 or WinME.
> 
> Dave
> 
>
